author: Juan Forero
title: Utah Missionary Set to Be Freed From Venezuela Detention - WSJ
text:
A former missionary from Utah who spent two years in a Venezuelan prison in what human-rights lawyers called a trumped up case was released Saturday by President Nicolás Maduro’s authoritarian government as an olive branch as it faces intensifying U.S. sanctions.
Joshua Holt, 26, and his Venezuelan wife, Thamara Caleno, were expected to arrive in Washington later Saturday. Mr. Holt had been held on espionage charges. Rights organizations have long said two were being used as bargaining chips by Mr. Maduro’s administration....
